info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 19 at 6:37PM EDT until August 19 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF EFFINGHAM...CHATHAM...BEAUFORT...HAMPTON AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 636 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Clyo to Ebenezer to near Marlow, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 6:20 PM the Effingham 911 Center reported a tree down in the Springfield area. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Hilton Head Island, Pooler, Bluffton, Beaufort, Port Royal, Ridgeland, Springfield, Bellinger Hill Area, Godley Station, Savannah International Airport, Clarendon, Jasper, Rincon, Port Wentworth and Hardeeville. This warning includes the following interstates: I-95 in South Carolina between mile markers 2 and 34. I-95 in Georgia between mile markers 107 and 112. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
